description.narrative:
Taxation is one of the most important links between the State and citizens, businesses. Understanding the tax helps people get a better idea of how the world operates and their role in that action chain. This helps readers make up a decision with their actions toinfluence how tax is collected and spent. In the context of worldwide tax authorities having difficulty dealing with tax evasion / avoidance businesses, consumer is the most influential factors to the business. The power of consumer has been proven through case studies such as Starbucks or Vedan. In the context of Vietnam, when organizations want to lobby for tax-related policies, consumer again become an agent supporting these policy advocates. This is a lengthy process that first and foremost need to start with providing the basic knowledge about tax to consumers. Currently, in Vietnam, tax information is presented mainly in the form of articles with written letters. Ech Phu Ho proposed a series of tax media products in the form of innovative, easy-to-understand expression to reach the audience in a better way. Objects: Internet users in Vietnam, ages 18-25. Reasons to choose this group of objects: # Prompt in receptivity, open-minded thinking - more accessible than middle-aged and elder groups # Positively spread, becoming a supporter of Oxfam policy advocacy # Being heavily influenced by tax and budget inequalities when curtailment categories of expenditures are often tended to be health or education. # The impact of the project on young people will affect the views of them in the future - whenthey are in positions that directly contribute to the development of the country. Purpose: # Provide basic knowledge and information on tax topics for youth # Promote discussion among youthabout tax topics # Establish a supportive youth group for Oxfam's tax and budget activities Form of operation and products: # Website and fanpage platforms with the mechanism of engaging readers (through open-ended questions, post schedule, response tocomments ...). # Interactive infographic (knowledge presentation): An infographic thatillustrates the sound, motion of character - data, a dialog box that interact with the user as they manipulate the mouse. Some interactive infographic may incorporatesmall surveys to gather the opinions of readers. # Interactive debate and survey: They are arguments codified according to pros <(>&<)> cons, presented in the form of two characters illustration arguing with arguments appear to correspond to the mouse manipulation. Debate will make the problem clear in many angles. Readers can comment on the points, like or dislike the points raised. After the debate, the reader takes a short survey around the issue. Surveys can be opened before posting products to compare survey results before and after the reader get more knowledge. # Update on Oxfam and its partners on the website/fanpage and connect young people who want to participate in (directly involved in the activity, suggest local resources, ask for scientific research information, contact Interview, writing ...) # Q <(>&<)> A Forum, in-depth discussion, additional materials, views.Once approved by the admin, they will update the interactive infographic or interactive debate.
Ech Phu Ho is a social enterpriseledbyyouth. Under this project, Ech Phu Ho wants to raise awareness among young people (aged 18-35) on tax justice. Through 7 online series of forums and debates (designed interactive videos, inforgraphic), the projectaims to inspire and empower 100,000 youngcitizens to participate and actively become supporters for tax justice in Vietnam.
